Wisdom: الرِّضَا غَنَاءٌ وَالسَّخَطُ عَنَاءٌ
enWisdom: Satisfaction is abundance while disappointment is agony

Wisdom: الرِّضَا بِالْكَفَافِ يُؤَدِّي إِلَى الْعَفَافِ
enWisdom: Being pleased with what suffices leads to virtue

Wisdom: الرِّضَا بِالْكَفَافِ خَيْرٌ مِنَ السَّعْيِ فِي الْإِسْرَافِ
enWisdom: Being pleased with what is sufficient is better than striving for lavishness

Wisdom: ارْضَ بِمَا قُسِمَ لَكَ تَكُنْ مُؤْمِناً
enWisdom: Be satisfied with that which has been apportioned for you and you will be a [true] believer

Wisdom: ارْضَ مِنَ الرِّزْقِ بِمَا قُسِمَ لَكَ تَعِشْ غَنِيّاً
enWisdom: Be satisfied with the sustenance that has been apportioned for you and you will live a life of prosperity

Wisdom: أَغْنَى النَّاسِ الرَّاضِي بِقَسْمِ اللَّهِ
enWisdom: The wealthiest of people is one who is pleased with what Allah has allotted to him

Wisdom: خُذْ مِنْ قَلِيلِ الدُّنْيَا مَا يَكْفِيكَ وَدَعْ مِنْ كَثِيرِهَا مَا يُطْغِيكَ
enWisdom: Take from the little of this world that which suffices you and leave from its abundance that which makes you transgress

Wisdom: حُسْنُ التَّقْدِيرِ مَعَ الْكَفَافِ خَيْرٌ مِنَ السَّعْيِ فِي الْإِسْرَافِ
enWisdom: Good estimation with sufficiency is better than striving in extravagance

Wisdom: حُسْنُ الْعَفَافِ وَالرِّضَا بِالْكَفَافِ مِنْ دَعَائِمِ الْإِيمَانِ
enWisdom: Virtuous chastity and contentment with what suffices are from the pillars of faith

Wisdom: خُذُوا مِنْ كَرَائِمِ [كَرِيمِ‏] أَمْوَالِكُمْ مَا يَرْفَعُ بِهِ رَبُّكُمْ سَنِيَّ أَعْمَالِكُمْ
enWisdom: Take from the most precious of your possessions and spend it on that for which your Lord will elevate your lofty deeds

Wisdom: رَأْسُ الْقَنَاعَةِ الرِّضَا
enWisdom: The cornerstone of contentment is satisfaction [with the decree of Allah]

Wisdom: طُوبَى لِمَنْ تَحَلَّى بِالْعَفَافِ وَرَضِيَ‏ بِالْكَفَافِ
enWisdom: Blessed is the one who adorns himself with virtue and is satisfied with what suffices

Wisdom: طُوبَى لِمَنْ خَافَ الْعِقَابَ وَعَمِلَ لِلْحِسَابِ وَصَاحَبَ الْعَفَافَ وَقَنِعَ بِالْكَفَافِ وَرَضِيَ عَنِ اللَّهِ سُبْحَانَهُ
enWisdom: Blessed is the one who fears the punishment [of the Hereafter], works for the Reckoning, espouses continence, is content with what suffices [him] and is pleased with [the decree of] Allah, the Glorified

Wisdom: كُلُّ مُقْتَصَرٍ عَلَيْهِ كَافٍ
enWisdom: Everything that one is contented with, suffices

Wisdom: كَفَى بِالرِّضَا غِنًى
enWisdom: Satisfaction suffices as abundance

Wisdom: كَفَى بِالسَّخَطِ عَنَاءً
enWisdom: Displeasure is enough of a suffering

Wisdom: مَنْ رَضِيَ [قَنِعَ‏] بِقِسْمِهِ اسْتَرَاحَ
enWisdom: One who is satisfied with his [allotted] portion is at ease

Wisdom: مَنْ رَضِيَ بِقِسْمِهِ لَمْ يُسْخِطْهُ أَحَدٌ
enWisdom: One who is satisfied with his portion will not be angered by anyone

Wisdom: مَنِ اقْتَصَرَ عَلَى قَدْرِهِ كَانَ أَبْقَى لَهُ
enWisdom: One who limits himself to his [rightful] status, it will be more lasting for him

Wisdom: مَنِ اقْتَصَرَ عَلَى الْكَفَافِ تَعَجَّلَ الرَّاحَةَ وَتَبَوَّأَ خَفْضَ الدَّعَةِ
enWisdom: One who limits himself to what suffices hastens comfort and lives in an abode of ease

Wisdom: مَنْ رَضِيَ بِقَسْمِ اللَّهِ لَمْ يَحْزَنْ عَلَى مَا فَاتَهُ
enWisdom: One who is pleased with the share allotted to him by Allah does not grieve for that which escapes him

Wisdom: لَا يُذْهِبُ الْفَاقَةَ مِثْلُ الرِّضَا وَالْقُنُوعِ
enWisdom: Nothing takes away poverty like satisfaction and contentment
